definition: Pathfinder, NASA spacecraft sent to Mars in 1977
to explore/to search out/to scout/to visit/to stretch forward

(after a verb or adjective) one who (is) .../(after a noun) person involved in .../-er/-ist/(used after a number or 後|后[hou4] or 前[qian2] to refer to sth mentioned previously)/(used after a term, to mark a pause before defining the term)/(old) (used at the end of a command)/(old) this

sentences.english: The spacecraft also contained a communications task that ran with medium priority.
sentences.chinese: 另外探路者号上还有一个中优先级的通信进程。

sentences.english: Keep the object selected and open the Pathfinder Palette.
sentences.chinese: 保持对象的选定，并打开探路者的调色盘。

sentences.english: As soon as the spacecraft landed, the Pathfinder went to work.
sentences.chinese: 甫一着陆，探路者立即展开工作。

sentences.english: As it turns out, the United States is not the only path-breaker.
sentences.chinese: 结果是，美国不仅仅是一个探路者。

definition: (bird species of China) Bohemian waxwing (Bombycilla garrulus)
abbr. for 珠穆朗瑪峰|珠穆朗玛峰, Mt Chomolungma or Qomolangma (Tibetan)/Mt Everest/Nepalese: Sagarmatha
to explore/to go on an expedition/adventure
Wangfujing neighborhood of central Beijing, famous for shopping
